meanings.definition: The plural form of pawpaw, a tropical fruit.
meanings.sent1: I love eating pawpaws for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The market sells fresh pawpaws every Saturday.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the zoo enjoy munching on pawpaws.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a ripe pawpaw.
meanings.sent5: The scent of ripe pawpaws filled the air at the picnic.

meanings.definition: A pawpaw tree, a small deciduous tree native to North America.
meanings.sent1: The pawpaws in the backyard provide shade in the summer.
meanings.sent2: We planted a new pawpaw near the creek.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels play hide-and-seek around the pawpaws.
meanings.sent4: The old pawpaw stood tall like a guardian of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the pawpaw rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To pawpaw, to gently touch or stroke with the hand.
meanings.sent1: She would pawpaw the kitten's fur until it purred contentedly.
meanings.sent2: The child would pawpaw the soft blanket while falling asleep.
meanings.sent3: He tried to pawpaw the stubborn knot out of the rope.
meanings.sent4: The artist would pawpaw the canvas with delicate strokes.
meanings.sent5: The gentle waves would pawpaw the sandy shore at sunset.
